direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods create and add a new element to the current element's children, but at different positions (start vs. end).
Both methods add a new node to the current element's children, but prependElement specifically adds an Element, while appendChild can add any type of Node.
Both methods add a new node to the start of the current element's children, but prependElement specifically creates an Element, while prependChild can add any type of Node.

Both methods involve inserting child nodes into the current element, but prependElement specifically inserts a single Element at the start, while insertChildren can insert multiple nodes at a specified index.
Both methods handle the addition of content to the current element, but prependElement adds an Element, while append adds a string of HTML content.
Both methods involve adding content to the current element, but prependElement adds an Element, while prepend adds a string of HTML content at the start.
